Posts.Content: As a nurse, the smell is certainly that of rotting flesh, and is very distinctive. There's nothing to do to get rid of the smell, you just know what it is when you smell it. Our noses can diagnose better than PET scans sometimes, I think.
Posts.Title: Cancer smell

Posts.Content: I'm a RN and right now I have two cancer patients. One is completely riddled with cancer, abdominal organs, spine, bones, prostate and he has no distinctive odor. The other has lung and bone cancer and he absolutely smells like cancer - the rotting flesh smell. I don't know what makes the difference between the two.
Posts.Title: Cancer smell
